statement: The system shall provide a budgeting portal, a reporting portal, a scheduling portal, and a fan portal for consumers, fans, and users.
The system shall have the ability to specify budget policy.
The system shall include a timestamp and additional relevant information for each event in the reports.
The system shall allow unregistered users to view game-related data, including results.
The system shall allow the team manager and team administration to access and analyze the financial data offline.
The system shall provide guidance on how to allocate referees to games.
The system shall facilitate the definition of a policy for assigning referees to games and automatically assign referees based on that policy, and enable referees to input their preferences.
The system shall allow for manual adjustment of the schedule.
The system shall require confirmation of a schedule change by another IFA representative.
The system shall require approval from two IFA representatives for scheduling decisions.
The system shall enforce a minimum gap of at least one day before playing the next game, with an option for a two-day gap.
The system shall allow parameters to be defined within it.
The system shall enable the referees and official channels to be the only source of data about the games.
The system shall support the team manager in submitting a report to the IFA once a year.
The system shall provide a reasonable response time.
The system shall be highly responsive and provide real-time processing, prioritizing referee-related activities over other stadium activities.
The system shall assign a high priority to event reporting when a user is in a game to enable quick reporting of events.
The system shall have all storage and computing handled by an external company using a cloud service after it is up and running.
The system shall be adjustable to comply with local regulations and reviews.
The system shall encrypt budget data to prevent leakage.
The system shall allow team managers or owners to register for the system via the internet for identification purposes.
The system shall retain all past scheduling archives.
The system shall allow users to define the league, define the season, appoint or register referees, set budget policies, and set scheduling policies for referee scheduling.
